canonical_structure.name: UBX-NAV-AOPSTATUS
canonical_structure.description: This message provides information on the status of the AssistNow Autonomous subsystem on the receiver. For example, a host application can determine the optimal time to shut down the receiver by monitoring the status field for a steady 0.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch.

fields.name: status
fields.description: AssistNow Autonomous subsystem is idle (0) or running (not 0)

issues: Uses 'reserved1' instead of 'reserved0', common in older protocol specifications

valid_variations.reason: Some manual versions represent the status field as a hex/bitmask type (X1) rather than an unsigned integer (U1), though the binary representation is identical (1 byte).
Older generations (u-blox 8) often use a different index for reserved fields (reserved1) compared to modern versions (reserved0).

adjudication.reasoning: All extractions are highly consistent regarding the message structure (16 bytes total, specific offsets for iTOW, aopCfg, and status). The variations observed are purely nomenclature-based (U1 vs X1 for the status byte, or reserved0 vs reserved1 naming), which is common across different generations of u-blox documentation (M8, M9, M10, F10). The message type varies between 'output' and 'periodic_polled' depending on whether the manual uses older or newer classification terminology.
